And when the day came on June 2nd, 1979, and one million Poles gathered around Victory Square for their very first mass with their Polish Pope, that day, every communist in Warsaw must have known that their oppressive system would soon come crashing down.  (Applause.)  They must have known it at the exact moment during Pope John Paul II’s sermon when a million Polish men, women, and children suddenly raised their voices in a single prayer.  A million Polish people did not ask for wealth.  They did not ask for privilege.  Instead, one million Poles sang three simple words:  “We Want God.”  -- Donald Trump

全世界都有学生，全世界的学生因为没有亲身创造过价值都共享同一个毛病:左。西方著名段子:"年轻时不左没长心，成年后还左没长脑袋"。正常国家，学生闹事大家看着，只要别出格随便他们闹，不去鼓励他们，也不去打击他们。只有邪恶的国家，一群老奸巨猾的成年人躲在背后:"上!冲!你们才是英雄".

Judge Alex Kozinsky on *The Second Ammendment*:


The Second Amendment is a doomsday provision, one designed for those exceptionally rare circumstances where all other rights have failed—where the government refuses to stand for reelection and silences those who protest; where courts have lost the courage to oppose, or can find no one to enforce their decrees. However improbable these contingencies may seem today, facing them unprepared is a mistake a free people get to make only once.

comment.body: @Azai: Yes, It's straightforward. And good luck here in zero-land.

@Flyman: I am afraid you are putting too much confidence on the fragile human kind in both its rational thinking and its moral inclination. If by separating 'good' and 'bad' is a vicious judgement, then what would be for 'light' and 'darkness'? There is truth in existence, and there are truth perceived. They are not equal!
@Eric1212: Hmm, we will see how it goes ...
